refnamediv.refpurpose: view system information and VM configuration details

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The VBoxManage list subcommands enable you to obtain information about the &product-name; software, the VMs and associated services that you create.

refsect2.title: Common Options

listitem.para: Shows detailed information about each information entry if available. The short form of this option is -l.
Sorts the list of information entries alphabetically. The short form of this option is -s.

refsect2.title: List the Bridged Network Interfaces on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list bridgedifs command lists the bridged network interfaces that are currently available on the host system. The output shows detailed configuration information about each interface. See .

refsect2.title: List the Cloud Network Interfaces
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list cloudnets command lists the cloud network interfaces that have been configured. A cloud network interface provides connectivity between local VMs and a cloud network.

refsect2.title: List the Cloud Profiles
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list cloudprofiles command lists the cloud profiles that have been configured. A cloud profile contains settings for a cloud service account.

refsect2.title: List the Cloud Providers
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list cloudproviders command lists the cloud providers that are supported by &product-name;. Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is an example of a cloud provider.

refsect2.title: List the known CPU Profiles
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list cpu-profiles command lists the CPU profiles that are known by &product-name;.

refsect2.title: List the DHCP Servers on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list dhcpservers command lists the DHCP servers that are currently available on the host system. The output shows detailed configuration information about each DHCP server. See .

refsect2.title: List the DVD Virtual Disk Images
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list dvds command shows information about the DVD virtual disk images that are currently in use by the &product-name; software. For each image, the output shows all the settings, the UUIDs associated with the image by &product-name;, and all files associated with the image.
This command performs the same function as the Virtual Media Manager. See .

refsect2.title: List the Installed &product-name; Extension Packs
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list extpacks command shows all &product-name; extension packs that are currently installed. See and .

refsect2.title: List the Floppy Disk Virtual Disk Images
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list floppies command shows information about the floppy disk images that are currently in use by the &product-name; software. For each image, the output shows all the settings, the UUIDs associated with the image by &product-name;, and all files associated with the image.
This command performs the same function as the Virtual Media Manager. See .

refsect2.title: List the Virtual Machine Groups
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list groups command shows all VM groups. See .

refsect2.title: List the Virtual Disk Backends
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hddbackends command lists all known virtual disk backends of the &product-name; software. For each such format, such as VDI, VMDK, or RAW, this command lists the backend's capabilities and configuration.

refsect2.title: List the Hard Disk Virtual Disk Images
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hdds command shows information about the hard disk virtual disk images that are currently in use by the &product-name; software. For each image, the output shows all the settings, the UUIDs associated with the image by &product-name;, and all files associated with the image.
This command performs the same function as the Virtual Media Manager. See .

refsect2.title: List the CPUID Information for the Host System CPUs
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hostcpuids command lists CPUID information for each CPU on the host system. Use this information to perform a more fine grained analyis of the host system's virtualization capabilities.

refsect2.title: List the Storage Drives on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hostdrives command lists the disk drives on the host system potentially useful for creating a VMDK raw disk image. Each entry includes the name used to reference them from within &product-name;.

refsect2.title: List the DVD Drives on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hostdvds command lists the DVD drives on the host system. Each DVD entry includes the name used to access them from within &product-name;.

refsect2.title: List the Floppy Disk Drives on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hostfloppies command lists the floppy disk drives on the host system. Each floppy disk entry includes the name used to access them from within &product-name;.

refsect2.title: List Information About the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hostinfo command shows information about the host system. The output includes information about the CPUs, memory, and the OS version.

refsect2.title: List the Host-Only Network Interfaces on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hostonlyifs command lists the host-only network interfaces that are currently available on the host system. The output shows detailed configuration information about each interface. See .

refsect2.title: List Host-Only Networks
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list hostonlynets command lists the host-only networks that have been configured. A host-only network provides connectivity between the host and local VMs. See .

refsect2.title: List Internal Networks
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list intnets command shows information about the internal networks. See .

refsect2.title: List the NAT Network Interfaces on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list natnets command lists the NAT network interfaces that are currently available on the host system. See .

refsect2.title: List the Guest Operating Systems
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list ostypes command lists all guest operating systems (OSes) that are known to &product-name;. Each OS entry includes an identifier, a description, a family identifier, a family description, and whether the OS has 64-bit support.
You can use these identifiers with the VBoxManage modifyvm command.

refsect2.title: List the Guest Operating System Subtypes
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list ossubtypes command lists all guest operating system (OS) subtypes along with the associated guest OS descriptions that are known to &product-name;. Each list entry includes a guest OS family identifier, the guest OS subtypes associated with that OS family (if any), and a description the guest OSes associated with that OS subtype.

refsect2.title: List the Running Virtual Machines
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list runningvms command lists all virtual machines (VMs) that are currently running. By default this displays a compact list that shows the name and UUID of each VM.

refsect2.title: List the Available Screen Shot Formats
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list screenshotformats command shows the list of available screen shot formats.

refsect2.title: List System Properties
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list systemproperties command shows a large collection of global &product-name; settings and limits, such as minimum and maximum guest RAM, virtual hard disk size, folder settings, and the current authentication library in use.

refsect2.title: List the Registered Global USB Filters
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list usbfilters command lists all global USB filters registered with &product-name; and displays the filter parameters. Global USB filters are for devices which are accessible to all virtual machines.

refsect2.title: List the USB Devices on the Host System
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list usbhost command shows information about the USB devices that are attached to the host system. The output includes information that you can use to construct USB filters and indicates whether the device is currently in use by the host system.

refsect2.title: List Virtual Machines
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list vms command lists all virtual machines (VMs) that are currently registered with &product-name;. By default this command displays a compact list that shows the name and UUID of each VM.

refsect2.title: List the Webcams Attached to a Running Virtual Machine
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage list webcams command shows the list of webcams that are attached to the running VM.
The output is a list of absolute paths or aliases that are used to attach the webcams to the VM by using the VBoxManage webcam attach command.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: The following command lists the VM groups configured for &product-name;.
The following command lists the VMs that are currently running.
